keyEvents.description: Nami discovers the treasure vault is empty
keyEvents.significance: Reveals that Thriller Bark's treasure has been stolen or moved

keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats engage in coordinated battle against Oars on Thriller Bark
keyEvents.significance: Major battle location showcasing the crew's teamwork against a giant opponent

keyEvents.description: Brook searches the kitchen for milk and salt
keyEvents.significance: Shows Brook's preparation for zombie combat

description: The world's largest pirate ship, converted into an island by Gecko Moria. It serves as his base of operations and is populated by zombies created using stolen shadows.
geography: A massive ship containing mansions, forests, graveyards, and various structures
politicalStatus: Territory of Gecko Moria, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
historicalSignificance: Former pirate ship converted into a mobile island fortress

keyEvents.description: Bartholomew Kuma mysteriously appears on the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.significance: Introduces a major threat arriving while the crew is occupied with Oars, creating additional tension

description: The second ship of the Straw Hat Pirates, built by Franky and the Galley-La Company. A brigantine-rigged sloop with a lion figurehead that can execute the Coup de Burst.
geography: A ship with multiple decks, including a lawn deck, aquarium bar, library, men's quarters, women's quarters, and various other facilities
politicalStatus: Pirate ship of the Straw Hat Pirates
historicalSignificance: Built from the legendary Adam Wood, same material as Gol D. Roger's ship
